skill.name: commit-prepare
skill.description: Prepare git commit messages for template changes following conventional commits. Activates on: commit, prepare commit, commit this, commit message, ready to commit
skill.summary: Prepare git commit messages for template changes following conventional commits. Activates on: commi...
skill.author: ByronWilliamsCPA

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Contains only git workflow guidance and commit message templates for conventional commits. No network calls, no file writes beyond user-initiated git operations, no credential access.

content.value_statement: Writing clear commit messages helps teams understand code history. This skill automatically generates properly formatted commit messages following conventional commits standards for better project maintainability.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes staged git changes to determine commit type and scope
Generates conventional commit messages following feat, fix, docs, refactor, chore patterns
Uses template-specific scopes like template, hooks, config, ci, and docs
Formats multi-line commit messages with proper body and footer sections
Suggests separate commits when changes span multiple scopes
Includes AI attribution in commit messages
limitations: Does not automatically stage files without user confirmation
Does not push commits to remote repositories
Does not amend or modify existing commits
Does not execute git commands without explicit user approval

use_cases.title: Maintain clean commit history
use_cases.description: Generate standardized commit messages that make changelog generation and release notes automatic

use_cases.title: Follow team conventions
use_cases.description: Create consistent commit messages that integrate with semantic release and automated versioning tools

use_cases.title: Document template changes
use_cases.description: Apply template-specific scopes for hooks, config, and CI changes in cookiecutter projects

prompt_templates.title: Basic commit
prompt_templates.prompt: Commit my staged changes with a conventional commit message

prompt_templates.title: Feature commit
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare a feat: commit message for my new feature implementation

prompt_templates.title: Bug fix
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a fix: commit message for this bug fix with impact description

prompt_templates.title: Multi-file changes
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze my staged changes and suggest whether to split them into multiple commits or use a combined message

output_examples.input: Prepare a commit message for my staged changes
output: Analyzed staged changes: 3 files modified in template directory
- Include dependency and database connectivity checks
- Return JSON response with timestamp and status
Ready to commit? Reply 'yes' to execute or describe changes you'd like to make.

best_practices: Review the generated message before confirming the commit
Use multi-line format for commits with non-trivial changes
Separate concerns into distinct commits when changes affect multiple areas
anti_patterns: Using vague messages like 'fix bug' or 'update code' without specifics
Skipping the body section for non-trivial changes
Creating large commits that mix features, fixes, and documentation changes

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Activates on commit-related keywords.

faq.question: What commit types are supported?
faq.answer: feat, fix, docs, refactor, chore, ci, and style following conventional commits specification.

faq.question: Can this skill push to remote?
faq.answer: No. The skill only prepares commit messages. Users must explicitly run git push themselves.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill runs read-only git commands to analyze changes. All commit operations require explicit user approval.

faq.question: Why use conventional commits?
faq.answer:: Conventional commits enable automated changelog generation, semantic versioning, and clearer project history.

faq.question: How is this different from other commit tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides template-specific scopes for cookiecutter projects and follows strict conventional commits formatting.
